summary:
Scandinavia is a region in Europe with close connections between Denmark, Norway, and Sweden. It also includes parts of Finland and Iceland due to their shared history and language. The area is known for its diverse geography, from mountains to fjords.

During the Viking Age, Scandinavians explored and raided many places in Europe and even reached North America. Over time, the region became Christian and experienced various political unions and wars. Today, these countries are known for their strong economies and generous welfare systems, often called the "Nordic model."
title: Scandinavia
